CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 17, 1963, pg. C8, reads: "Monarchs in New Uniforms - Thank to an anonymous donor, who apparently gets a kick out of seeing youngsters working together, at a common cause, the Pittsburgh Monarchs baseball entry is seen sporting new uniforms. Seated in front is Gregory Benton, bat boy.  Kneeling (left to right) Alvin Muldrow, Larry Bryant, Ronald Jackson, Kenneth Spencer, John Williams, Tyrone Scott and Lewis Johnson.  Standing: Coach Al Jackson, Robert Perry, Thomas Bold, DeCanie Benson, David Jones, John Jackson, John Gobble, James Colvin and Mrs. Albert Broaden, general manager. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Monarchs baseball team, including bat boy Gregory Benton in front; kneeling from left: Alvin Muldrow, Larry Bryant, Ronald Jackson, Kenneth Spencer, John Williams, Tyrone Scott, Lewis Johnson; standing: Coach Al Jackson, Robert Perry, Thomas Bold, DeCanie Benson, David Jones, John Jackson, John Gobble, James Colvin, and manager Alberta Broaden, posed on playing field
